prompt:
Nurse: Do you have a cut near your rectum?

Patient: What? No. Not that I know of.

Nurse: Is there any more information you want to share about this issue?

Patient: Rachel, are you there?

Nurse: Hold on a second while I figure out how I can best support you. Just give me a second to work out the best way I can assist you.

Patient: Well, you're supposed to be talking to me about this colonoscopy that I have. I'm not sure what else you wanna help me with.

Nurse: Just give me a second to work out the best way I can assist you. I apologize for the confusion earlier. I'm here to ensure you have everything you need for your colonoscopy. I hope this procedure gives you and your doctor the answers you're looking for. Would it be okay if we go over a few topics on prep for your colonoscopy?

Patient: Yes.

responses.gpt4: Great. Let's first get all the logistics out of the way. I would like to remind you that your colonoscopy procedure is on August 17 at 11:00 AM with Dr. Meredith Bailey. You'll need to arrive at O'Connor Hospital about 1 hour before your procedure time, at 10:00 AM. Is this okay with you?
responses.our_model: Thank you. I'm calling today to ensure you have everything you need. I will also call you again the day before your procedure. Let's first get all the logistics out of the way. Your colonoscopy procedure is on August 17 at 11:00 AM with Doctor Meredith Bailey. You'll need to arrive about 1 hour before at 10:00 AM. Is that okay with you?
